Operation 'post-getCostEstimate' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Get a fees cost estimate' is too generic and doesn't specify what type of fees. Description is verbose and repetitive, making it harder for AI agents to extract key information. Improved summary specifies 'interchange and scheme fees' for clarity. Improved description reorganizes information to clearly state: purpose (pre-calculate fees), geographic availability, expected inputs (transaction details and assumptions), outputs (fee estimates and surcharging policies), and important caveats about estimation accuracy. This helps AI agents better understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.current_description:
This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
data.summary_suggestion: Estimate interchange and scheme fees for transaction
data.description_suggestion: Pre-calculates interchange and scheme fee costs for a transaction to determine potential surcharging options. Available only for merchants in Australia, the EU, and the UK. Accepts transaction details and assumption criteria (such as 3D Secure authentication status and Level 2/3 data availability) in the request. Returns estimated interchange and scheme fees charged by the payment network, along with applicable surcharging policies based on current regulations. Note: Returned amounts are estimates based on provided assumptions, as some transaction details may not be known until authorization.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get a fees cost estimate' is too generic and doesn't specify what type of fees. Description is verbose and repetitive, making it harder for AI agents to extract key information. Improved summary specifies 'interchange and scheme fees' for clarity. Improved description reorganizes information to clearly state: purpose (pre-calculate fees), geographic availability, expected inputs (transaction details and assumptions), outputs (fee estimates and surcharging policies), and important caveats about estimation accuracy. This helps AI agents better understand when to use this operation and what to expect.
